contentfulPhotoStory.title: Framing 2024: Images of crisis, recovery, and beyond
contentfulPhotoStory.introText: Scroll through a selection of images from our global contributors, offering insights into key moments in 2024.

seo.seoDescription: A selection of photos from our contributors all around the world.

photos.title: How rainwater harvesting has become a lifesaver in Bangladesh

slideContent.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"A boatman hurries across a river in western Khulna district as ominous rain clouds loom overhead. Bangladesh ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://che01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fclimateknowledgeportal.worldbank.org%2Fcountry%2Fbangladesh%2Fclimate-data-historical&data=05%7C02%7Cali%40thenewhumanitarian.org%7Cc2c44f1538434631b83708dc3172ad92%7C7f8fd4f108384e3ea8314b94f37dcdba%7C0%7C0%7C638439619176594584%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=tw9%2BZUge5SuZxyTyk7nlOS66scncC04vPVjPiyTzVs8%3D&reserved=0"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"averages 2,200 millimetres","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":" of rainfall annually – ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://data.worldbank.org/indicator/AG.LND.PRCP.MM?most_recent_value_desc=true"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"one of the highest amounts in the world","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":". In 2023, flash floods affected more than one million people and displaced over 200,000. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Efforts to harvest rainwater are transforming lives, while last year the Bangladeshi government eliminated a tax to lower the costs of running solar-powered desalination plants. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"hr","data":{},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Read the full story ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://www.thenewhumanitarian.org/photo-feature/2024/04/16/how-rainwater-harvesting-has-become-lifesaver-bangladesh"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"here","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":".","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

{"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://asia.oxfam.org/latest/press-release/bangladesh-floods-affected-communities-look-urgent-support-situation-dire#:~:text=The%20floods%20have%20also%20displaced,continues%20to%20pose%20significant%20challenges."},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Darién Gap","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":" – the perilous jungle territory connecting Colombia and Panama – is the only overland route between South and North America. And for most of those fleeing war, persecution, climate disaster, and poverty, crossing it is the only option to reach the United States, where they hope to find safety and new opportunities. ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"On the Panamanian side, migrants are easy prey to armed groups that rob and sexually abuse them. The photo shows a sign warning others of the danger. It says: ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"“They’re robbing further up, form big groups!!”","marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"hr","data":{},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Read the full story ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://www.thenewhumanitarian.org/opinion/first-person/2024/05/01/reporters-journey-through-darien-gap"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"here","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":".","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

{"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"University lecturer Mahmoud al-Ajouz takes stock of the damage in a teaching lab at Al-Azhar University’s faculty of medicine.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"The damage to Gaza’s education system is at all levels. More than 625,000 school-aged children are at risk of becoming “a lost generation”, according to ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://www.unrwa.org/newsroom/photos/education-under-attack"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"the UN","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":". Nearly ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://reliefweb.int/report/occupied-palestinian-territory/year-silence-gazas-classrooms-urgent-need-educational-revival-3-august-2024"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"93%","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":" of school buildings have been damaged or destroyed, or have been turned into shelters to house the ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://www.un.org/en/awake-at-night/s9-muhannad-hadi-i-promised-i-will-tell-story"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"1.9 million people","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":" (about 90% of the population) displaced from their homes.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"hr","data":{},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Read the full story ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://www.thenewhumanitarian.org/news-feature/2024/09/26/inside-effort-help-gaza-university-students-continue-education-studies"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"here","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":".","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

photos.title: Myanmar struggling with a failing healthcare system

slideContent.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"India’s sudden termination in February of a free movement agreement cut off access to essential services between Mizoram and the border areas of Myanmar, leaving nearly 100,000 residents of Kale township struggling with a failing healthcare system.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"“We depend on our brothers in Mizoram,” says ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Dr. Lalaramzaua, the only doctor at the RHI Hospital in the Myanmar border town of Rikhawdar. “I am helpless. I can’t  bear to see people like this.” ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"hr","data":{},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Read the full story ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://www.thenewhumanitarian.org/photo-feature/2024/08/21/border-closures-and-intensifying-conflict-worsen-myanmar-healthcare"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"here","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":".","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

photos.title: Ukrainian-Lebanese researcher and inventor, Nizar Al Rifai

slideContent.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Ukrainian-Lebanese researcher and inventor Nizar Al Rifai has been documenting the impact of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine on day-to-day life through his own unique blend of illustrations and photographs.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Before the war, he would travel around the area where he lives in a small electric car picking flowers from fields and watching the small aircraft that took off from a nearby airfield cruise through the sky.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"hr","data":{},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Read the full story ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://www.thenewhumanitarian.org/first-person/2024/02/22/ukraine-diary-reflecting-two-years-war"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"here","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":".","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

{"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Known as ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"El Muro de la Vergüenza","marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" or the Wall of Shame, this 10-kilometre partition separates settlements that people displaced by conflict – mostly Indigenous Peruvians – began setting up in Lima in the 1980s and 1990s from wealthier parts of the city.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"It has become a dramatic symbol of racial and class division in a city founded almost five centuries ago as Spain’s colonial capital in the Americas.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"hr","data":{},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Read the full story ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://www.thenewhumanitarian.org/news-feature/2024/01/05/peru-wall-of-shame-tear-down-symbol-colonialism-class-and-segregation"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"here","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":".","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

{"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Among those trying to flee Israeli airstrikes on Lebanon were migrant domestic workers from countries such as Kenya, the Philippines, and Ethiopia, but some felt trapped and unable to get to safety. Many of Lebanon’s 176,000 migrant domestic workers are women working in exploitative conditions for extremely low wages that make the cost of a ticket out of the country prohibitive.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Roise Njeri Mwaura, pictured with her five-year-old son Steve, is worried that if she leaves Lebanon, Steve won’t be allowed back in the country.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"hr","data":{},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Read the full story ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://www.thenewhumanitarian.org/news-feature/2024/09/26/lebanons-migrant-workers-left-stranded-homeless-israeli-attacks"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"here","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":".","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

{"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Hafsatu Hamman, 40, sews clothes for residents of the Wassa displacement camp in the Nigerian capital. Before the end of the month, she is expected to make her contribution of ₦4,000 to her Adashe group.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Adashe, a Hausa term, refers to a traditional savings system where group members pool money to support shared needs. In the camp, it provides displaced families a safety net, enabling women to save for expenses like school fees, medical care, and farming supplies.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"hr","data":{},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Read the full story ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://www.thenewhumanitarian.org/photo-feature/2024/01/23/money-clubs-help-displaced-nigerians-create-their-own-safety-nets"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"here","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":".","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

{"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Miguel Martir (in red) says he doesn’t mind being searched several times a week, as the security measures implemented by President Nayib Bukele in El Salvador have drastically reduced gang violence.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"However, critics say the crackdown has caused the government’s attention on humanitarian issues to dwindle, and that it’s the most vulnerable who are paying the highest cost for the country’s security.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"hr","data":{},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Read the full story ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://www.thenewhumanitarian.org/photo-feature/2024/03/13/el-salvador-peaceful-streets-carry-hidden-costs"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"here","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":".","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

{"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Congolese civil society and ordinary citizens have played a leading role in responding to the humanitarian fallout of the M23 insurgency, ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://www.thenewhumanitarian.org/news-feature/2024/04/11/congolese-displaced-m23-war-host-families-offer-heart-solidarity"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"hosting the majority","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":" of the 1.5 million displaced people, and running soup kitchens in camps.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Likewise, Congolese artists have been organising various cultural initiatives and events for affected people, from spoken word poetry sessions to dance spectacles and music concerts blasting Afrobeats and Ndombolo hits through the camps.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"hr","data":{},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Read the full story ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://www.thenewhumanitarian.org/photo-feature/2024/06/04/slam-poems-and-dance-shows-how-congolese-creatives-are-responding-m23"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"here","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":".","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

{"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"On 30 June, thousands of Venezuelans headed to the polls for an election rehearsal that was officially meant to help citizens familiarise themselves with technical changes to the electronic voting system.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"But it was also an opportunity for Nicolás Maduro to assess his level of popularity ahead of the 28 July presidential election, which he claims to have won despite evidence showing a convincing victory for opposition challenger Edmundo González.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"hr","data":{},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Read the full story ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://www.thenewhumanitarian.org/photo-feature/2024/07/08/election-looms-venezuela-see-saw-between-hope-and-fear"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"here","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":".","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

{"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Racine Ba drives his scooter through a souk in Marrakech. “My life changed when I arrived in Marrakech,” says Ba, who came from Senegal in 2011 and now works in a historic tourist-friendly guesthouse. “Here, I really started to feel integrated: I found an open-minded atmosphere.”","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Morocco has positioned itself as a pro-migrant destination – a strategic decision motivated by both geopolitical and economic interests.","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"hr","data":{},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Read the full story ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"hyperlink","data":{"uri":"https://www.thenewhumanitarian.org/news-feature/2024/01/16/morocco-cashing-in-south-south-migration-africa"},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"here","marks":[{"type":"underline"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"text","value":".","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}
